etymology.description: 拉 (pull/draw) + 制 (make/form) = produce by pulling (metal drawing process).
etymology.interpretation: Refers to shaping metal by pulling it through a die to reduce cross‑section and increase length. Commonly used for wire and tubing production.
etymology.simplification: 製 → 制: the traditional 製 (‘to manufacture’) was simplified by dropping the 衣 component, merging with 制 in Mainland usage; thus 拉製 → 拉制.

parts.english: to pull; to drag; to draw; to stretch
to make; manufacture; system; to control

examples.chinese: 这种材料适合拉制细管(這種材料適合拉製細管)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhǒng cáiliào shìhé lāzhì xìguǎn.
examples.english: This material is suitable for drawing fine tubes.

examples.chinese: 通过多道次拉制(通過多道次拉製)，截面更加均匀(截面更加均勻)。
examples.pinyin: Tōngguò duō dàocì lāzhì, jiémiàn gèngjiā jūnyún.
examples.english: With multiple drawing passes, the cross-section becomes more uniform.

examples.chinese: 拉制前需对坯料进行润滑处理(拉製前需對坯料進行潤滑處理)。
examples.pinyin: Lāzhì qián xū duì pēiliào jìnxíng rùnhuá chǔlǐ.
examples.english: Before drawing, the billet needs lubrication treatment.
